Detailed Description

Cell in the Qt graphics framework with ODE object definition.

Member Function Documentation

void GraphicsCellODE::setPos ( qreal  x,
qreal  y 
) [virtual]

Overloaded version: set the position of both GraphicsCell object and ODE object, warning: coordinates in argument should be in ODE (normal) system.

Remark: method is private in order to prevent confusion with the different coordinate system. Cell position can only be changed from the GraphicsCellScene class.

  • Set the GraphicsCell position.

  • Set the ODE object position.

Reimplemented from GraphicsCell.

void GraphicsCellODE::setAngle ( double  angle  )  [virtual]

Set the angle of both GraphicsCell and ODE objects.

  • Set angle of GraphicsCell object.

  • Set the rotation matrix R corresponding to the orientation defined by the angle parameter.

  • The axis of rotation is in the xy plane and is perpendicular to the cell orientation. The angle of rotation is 90 degrees.

Reimplemented from GraphicsCell.

void GraphicsCellODE::setCellLength ( double  length  )  [virtual]

Set the cell length of both GraphicsCell and ODE objects.

This method destroys and re-create a ODE cell object.

  • Set the cell length of GraphicsCell object.

  • Get body position and orientation.

  • Get the cell height from the GraphicsCell object.

  • Initiate geometry (object shape).

  • Initiate body (mass, inertia).

  • Associate body and geometry.

  • Set geometry and body position to the same position as before.

  • Set geometry and body rotation to the same rotation as before.

  • Restrict movement to the plane.

Reimplemented from GraphicsCell.

void GraphicsCellODE::duplicateCell ( GraphicsCell *  newCell,
double  cellLength0 
)

Duplicate cell and write the daughter cell in the newCell pointer.

Allocation of the new cell is not managed by this method. Daughter cell should be allocated before calling this method and its pointer passed as argument. In addition to the method from GraphicsCell, it duplicates the ODE cell object.

  • Duplicate the cell with method from GraphicsCell.

  • Create the new ODE cell object of the daughter cell.

  • Update the cell length of the mother cell.

  • Set the ODE position of both cells to their GraphicsItem position.
    • Remark: Take care of conversion between GraphicsScene and ODE coordinates!

  • Set the position of the mother cell.

  • Set the position of the daughter cell.

Reimplemented from GraphicsCell.

dWorldID GraphicsCellODE::ODE_getWorld (  )  const

dSpaceID GraphicsCellODE::ODE_getSpace (  )  const

void GraphicsCellODE::ODE_createCell ( dWorldID  world,
dSpaceID  space,
dReal  radius,
dReal  length,
dReal  angle 
)

Create the ODE cell object.

  • Set the ODE world and space.

  • Initiate geometry (object shape).
    • The geometry is set to a capped cylinder (radius and length).

  • Initiate body (mass, inertia).

  • The body is set to a capped cylinder with constant density and total mass of 1.0.

  • Associate body and geometry.

  • Rotate object.

  • The axis of rotation is in the xy plane and is perpendicular to the cell orientation. The angle of rotation is 90 degrees.

  • Restrict movement of the object to the xy plane.

  • Set a random color.

  • Initiate the openGL cylinder (quadric pointer).

void GraphicsCellODE::ODE_render (  )  const

Get the translation and rotation transformation from the ODE object and adapt it to the openGL system, then call ODE_renderInLocalFrame().

TinyVector< double, 2 > GraphicsCellODE::ODE_getPosition (  )  const

double GraphicsCellODE::ODE_getAngle (  )  const

Compute the angle of the cell orientation in the xy plane.

  • Get the quaternion matrix of the ODE geometry.

  • Remark: a quaternion is equal to (cos(alpha/2),sin(alpha/2)*u), where u is a unit vector of the rotation axis.
    • Remark: the rotation axis should already be in the xy plane and the rotation angle should be 90 degrees.

  • Calculate the orientation of the rotation axis in the xy plane, Euler psi angle.

  • The orientation of the cell is perpendicular to the rotation axis.

  • Transform from radians to degrees.

void GraphicsCellODE::ODE_AlignToZAxis (  ) 

Correct the angular velocity and rotation matrix to verify the xy plane constrain.

void GraphicsCellODE::ODE_updateODECellLength (  ) 

Update the ODE cell length from the GraphicsCell object length.

This method destroys and re-create a ODE cell object (it seems the only way to do it).

  • Get the cell length from the cellLength_ member of GraphicsCell (updated in the simulation).

  • Set the cell length.

dBodyID GraphicsCellODE::ODE_getBody (  )  const

void GraphicsCellODE::ODE_renderInLocalFrame (  )  const [protected]

Draw the cell (capped cylinder) in the openGL framework in the local frame of the object.

The method ODE_render() takes care of rotating and translating the frame in the global openGL scene.
